reviews.review_text: I actually really do like this serum.  I view bifida ferment lysate as a soothing ingredient. I do wish they'd also drop the dyes since they don't serve a real purpose.  I like the natural scent this product has- it's almost like a gingery Cola smell.  I love pairing this serum with other pre and probiotic ingredients like oats, thermal spring water, snail mucin, etc. for soothing the skin.  I took one star off for the insane price point.  It's a good serum but extreme price tags are rarely justified.  There are many other more affordable bifida products on the market that would provide similar results

reviews.review_text: I first used this during my mid twenties when ANR was still the original formula - before it underwent god knows how many reincarnations. Back then I used to find it would help a little with the odd acne mark that would appear every few weeks but did little else for my skin concerns. I was primarily using it in the hopes of some sort of defense against future ageing, but I can't say whether or not it achieved anything, as once the bottle ran out I started using other products and then recently thought why not give it another go?   So onto the latest version 'Synchronized Recovery Complex' which I tried earlier this year. I don't know if it's the fact that 'Tocopherol Acetate' (Vitamin E) has been pushed down to 30th place on ingredients list (used to be 13th), or whether it's because 'Retinyl Palmitate (an ester of Vitamin A) has been completely removed from the new version, but this one didn't do anything for acne marks whatsoever and I used it for over a month. It makes sense as both of those ingredients, especially Vitamin A in any form, are known to help fade marks. Add to that a whole host of new and unpronounceable ingredients and that probably explains why if anything I'd experienced even more breakouts when using this...although which one (or more) of the many new ingredients is the culprit I couldn't say! Not sure why they just couldn't let a good thing be and have to change/ruin it?   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. reviews.review_text: I think the main benefit of this product is it's penetrating and hydrating ingredients. You mix Squalane, Glycerin, and Hyaluronic Acid together with the elevating Caffeine and other ingredients...you can't possibly not get moisturized skin. It's soothing and has many benefits without drawbacks. It doesn't conflict with any actives or retinols in the routine yet offers that extra shot of supple hydration that your skin needs if you are introducing it to chemicals regularly. It seems that the main attractiveness of this serum is it's patented formula that is fast penetrating. When doing a skincare routine you want the product to get into your skin as fast and deep as possible in order to reap the benefits, so I assume that is the advantage of a more expensive, high-end serum versus a more basic combination of ingredients offered at a lower price. I think this product would probably benefit mature skin immensely while younger skin can take more preventive steps at a more affordable price. I received this sample in the Best of Dermstore kit and hope to continue to include this in my skincare in the future.

reviews.review_title: Hydrating Night Serum, Not The Best Anti-Aging
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product is very hydrating, and I like that it‚Äôs a gentle nighttime serum. It also helped calm my skin during what was probably the WORST breakout of my life, like bordering on cystic acne level and I haven‚Äôt had a problem with acne (other than a few zits here and there over the years) in like 15+ years. That was definitely a relief. Personally, I really liked it and I thought the little sample bottle I got free from Influenster lasted a long time (10ml, no dropper to measure, used almost every night starting late August with very little left now, 10/26 so with that in mind a 1oz bottle very well could last 6+ months for me) I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd be willing to pay $75+ for just the hydrating properties and small boost in radiance. When I‚Äôm seeking an anti-aging product like this, I generally reach for retinol serums - though they are a little harsher on your skin they compared to this, a very gentle serum, I see more anti-aging results with the retinol serum I currently have. That visibly reduced the ‚Äúfrown line‚Äù between my brows, and all but got rid of my smile lines. Advanced Night Repair did not help with those things. So I suppose whether you like it or not, really depends on what you‚Äôre looking for. If you want smoother skin, hydrated skin, more radiance, this serum is for you and you are really going to love it & start to see results after a week or so. But if you‚Äôre in your early 30‚Äôs, looking for help with fine lines and early wrinkles, loss of plumpness in your face, I‚Äôd recommend Sunday Riley A+ Retinoid serum, and start to see results from that after induction + a month or so of continued use. Despite not having retinol, I‚Äôd still recommend it as a good product for certain skin issues like dryness & dullness.

reviews.review_text: I received a sample of the Advanced Night Repair Synchronized Multi-Recovery Complex compliments of influenster and Est√©e Lauder to use for one week and I liked it. While it is fragrance-free, there‚Äôs a fermented scent some might not love though it fades quickly and didn‚Äôt bother me. My skin quickly soaked it up and I was blown away by how deeply moisturized it left my skin, especially when paired with the Intense Reset Concentrate!   My skin felt soft, smooth and incredibly hydrated ‚Äî it even looked more plump and radiant when I woke up. I was also impressed with the skin barrier repair function and how quickly it relieved my sensitive skin‚Äôs retinoid-induced irritation. I was, however, disappointed in the inclusion of sodium hyaluronate over a direct form of hyaluronic acid, which offers pro-repair support far beyond basic water hydration that sodium hyaluronate offers. That would be my expectation of a hyaluronic acid serum at this price point.  This ANR serum seems promising, but one week simply isn‚Äôt enough time to see noticeable results that justify the $75/oz price. As such, I cannot speculate whether it delivers promised results with consistent use of at least 2 months (I‚Äôm skeptical of the 72 hour hydration claims). I gave it 3 stars because of the price and the cheaper form of hyaluronic acid. If you aren‚Äôt price sensitive and/or are looking for a hydrating peptide serum, I did enjoyed and recommend trying the new ANR Synchronized Multi-Recovery Complex.

reviews.review_text: I received this product to try through Influenster. I really liked the way it made my skin feel and appear. I could definitely feel my skin smooth out and appear brighter.

The smell was horrible. The product is entirely too expensive to be so lackluster. The texture it was on par with the smell and after continuous usage there was no actual improvement or difference in my skin then using my less expensive products.
